snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin told reporters that while there was “nothing good” about the band members’ demonstration, “nonetheless, I do not think that they should be judged severely for this.”
abstract: Many Russians, including Pres Vladimir V Putin, express mixed feelings about whether three young members of feminist punk rock band Pussy Riot, who were arrested for staging a guerrilla performance on the altar of an Russian Orthodox cathedral in Moscow, should face a harsh punishment.

byline.contributor: Andrew Roth, Nikolay Khalip and Anna Tikhomirova contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin told reporters that while there was “nothing good” about the band members’ demonstration, “nonetheless, I do not think that they should be judged severely for this.”

headline.seo: Putin Says Go Easy on Punk Band, but Others Want Members Jailed
headline.main: Mixed Russian Feelings on Jailed Punk Rock Band
headline.print_headline: Mixed Russian Feelings On Jailed Punk Rock Band
